column4: I'm trying to install Pidgin from source and I get this error with I try to "make" it: make: *** No targets specified and no makefile found.  Stop.
why do you want to compile
Heard compiling from source is the only way to get MSN/Gtalk to work.
wrong info!!!
you need to install gnu-tls and then recompile!!!
Can't find that package :\
hang on
that is libgnutls and install its -dev too ... that would be sudo apt-get install libgnutls libgnutls-dev
hey sorry there is only -dev just install that
Alright got it. But now pidgin isn't compiling :(
Getting this error: make: *** No targets specified and no makefile found.  Stop.
i think you should just install from the repo...it has got no problems
That did not fix the SSL problem :\
first uninstall the compiled version
Using Synaptic?
no use sudo make uninstall ...assuming that you had successfuly installed/compiled it
I never installed it LOL
Kept getting errors with compiling
then delete the source and use synaptic to install pidgin
murlidhar, there is a power cut here ...gotta go... sorry ...
Seeya
